title: Module 3 Assessment
description: Test your understanding of GPAI compliance requirements.

questions.question: When do GPAI obligations come into effect?
questions.explanation: Article 113(3)(b) specifies that Chapter V (GPAI obligations) applies from August 2, 2025.

questions.question: What computational threshold creates a presumption of systemic risk?
questions.explanation: Article 51 establishes that 10^25 FLOPS (cumulative training compute) creates a presumption of systemic risk.

questions.question: What must all GPAI providers make publicly available?
questions.explanation: Article 53(1)(d) requires GPAI providers to make publicly available a sufficiently detailed summary of training data content.

questions.question: What type of testing is required for systemic risk GPAI models?
questions.explanation: Article 55(1)(a) requires providers of systemic risk GPAI models to perform model evaluations including state-of-the-art adversarial testing.

questions.question: Who develops codes of practice for GPAI compliance?
questions.explanation: Article 56 provides for codes of practice developed with AI Office encouragement and stakeholder involvement including providers, civil society, and scientific community.

questions.question: Can downstream providers delegate their AI Act obligations to GPAI providers?
questions.explanation: Downstream providers cannot delegate away responsibility. When integrating GPAI models, they become responsible for the integrated AI system and must conduct their own conformity assessment if high-risk.

questions.question: When must existing GPAI models comply with new obligations?
questions.explanation: Article 111 provides that GPAI models placed on market before August 2, 2025 must comply with new obligations by August 2, 2027.

questions.question: What must GPAI providers include in their copyright policy?
questions.explanation: Article 53(1)(c) requires GPAI providers to put in place a policy to comply with Union copyright law, including identifying and respecting text and data mining opt-outs.
